intro: Casearia grandiflora var. hypoleuca, commonly known as the white-flowered casearia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white, tubular flowers. It produces small, spherical berries that are typically green when immature and turn red when mature. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and delicate floral display.
